section.name: CASE STUDY:  NURSING PRACTICE AND HIV+ PATIENTS

comments:
This course is directed at the need to increase nursing majors knowledge and
clinical expertise in the care of persons with HIV/AIDS. Hands on clinical practice with
nurses who are AIDS experts is combined with seminars that provide epidemiologic,
clinical assessment, infection control, symptom management, patient teaching,
psychosocial, ethical, cultural, political, and policy information.
In general, students enjoyed this course. They felt they learned a lot and this course
“opened up their eyes to HIV.”
This course is a case study, one of many that nursing students are required to take
in their junior or senior years.
*Based on 8 student reviews.
